author: Devan Cooper
text: sold a brand new item to a user who said it was worn when he got it. after going through the paypal claim it was decided to he was to return the item to get his refund even though he provided no evidence. how ever when i got the parcel it was a complete different item that the buyer sent back. after contacting grailed and paypal about this and provided not only photo evidence of the wrong item but also video of me opening the parcel they still somehow decided that i was in the wrong and they gave the buyer back his money and now he also has the shirt!! im not sure how grailed does not do anything to resolve these cases even though they claim to have seller protection....its a JOKE!! the seller protection is just them hopping that paypal makes the right choice which is in favour of the buyer  99% of the time because its not real people reviewing the case its automated robots which they told me on the phone...grailed literally does nothing to review the situation they just trust paypal robots and then say that they offer seller protection based off that. Ive contacted grailed now 3 times about this and every time i have gotten the response that paypal will take care of it for me as long as i provided evidence. well guess what they closed the case in favour of the buyer even after i sent a video of me opening the package with the wrong item in it!! what more evidence could you need to see that this person is scamming?! at this point im under the impression that grailed does not care about the people who sell and only care about the 10% they make off the buyers. If they actually refunded me for the fraud i have encountered it would cost them money and im sure thats the last thing they would want to do which is pathetic. million dollar company screwing over innocent people trying to make a side hustle all becuase they would rather rely on paypal to review the scams than actually do something about it themselves!
